title: C96-1062

sentences.text: A domain independent model is proposed for the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English .
This model is meant to account for productive rules of interpretation which are inferred from the morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics of the nominal constituents .
In particular , we make extensive use of Pustejovsky 's principles concerning the predicative information associated with nominals .
We argue that it is necessary to draw a line between generalizable semantic principles and domain-specific semantic information .
We explain this distinction and we show how this model may be applied to the interpretation of compounds in real texts , provided that complementary semantic information are retrieved .

Entity-a_domain_independent_model.label: A domain independent model
Entity-a_domain_independent_model.description: A domain independent model is a theoretical framework designed for the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English, focusing on generalizable semantic principles derived from the morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics of the constituents, while distinguishing between general and domain-specific semantic information.

Entity-interpretation_of_compound_in_rea.label: interpretation of compounds in real texts
aliases: the interpretation of compounds in real texts
interpretation of compounds in real texts
Entity-interpretation_of_compound_in_rea.description: The 'interpretation of compounds in real texts' refers to the application of a domain-independent model designed to automate the understanding of nominal compounds in English by utilizing morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics, as well as Pustejovsky's principles, to derive meaning from actual textual examples.

mentions.local_name: interpretation of compounds in real texts
the interpretation of compounds in real texts

Entity-this_model.label: This model
Entity-this_model.description: This model refers to a domain independent framework designed for the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English, focusing on the productive rules of interpretation derived from the morpho-syntactic and semantic features of the nominal constituents.

Entity-pustejovsky_s_principle.label: Pustejovsky's principles
Entity-pustejovsky_s_principle.description: Pustejovsky's principles refer to a set of theoretical concepts in semantics that focus on the predicative information associated with nominal compounds, emphasizing the distinction between generalizable semantic principles and domain-specific information.

Entity-model.label: model
Entity-model.description: The 'model' refers to a domain-independent framework designed for the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English, focusing on the productive rules of interpretation derived from the morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics of the constituents.

Entity-automated_interpretation.label: automated interpretation
Entity-automated_interpretation.description: Automated interpretation refers to a domain-independent model designed to analyze and derive meanings from nominal compounds in English by utilizing morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics.

Entity-this_distinction.label: this distinction
Entity-this_distinction.description: This distinction refers to the necessary separation between generalizable semantic principles and domain-specific semantic information in the context of interpreting nominal compounds.

Entity-automated_interpretation_of_nomin.label: automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English
aliases: the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English
automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English
Entity-automated_interpretation_of_nomin.description: The automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English refers to the computational process of analyzing and understanding the meaning of compound nouns in the English language without human intervention.

mentions.local_name: automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English
the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English

Entity-complementary_semantic_informatio.label: complementary semantic information
Entity-complementary_semantic_informatio.description: Complementary semantic information refers to the additional contextual or domain-specific insights that enhance the understanding and interpretation of nominal compounds in English, as utilized in the proposed model for automated interpretation.

Entity-principle.label: principles
Entity-principle.description: The term 'principles' refers to Pustejovsky's theoretical framework that outlines the predicative information associated with nominal compounds in English.

Entity-productive_rule_of_interpretation.label: productive rules of interpretation
Entity-productive_rule_of_interpretation.description: Productive rules of interpretation refer to the principles used to derive meanings from nominal compounds based on their morpho-syntactic and semantic features.

Entity-predicative_information.label: predicative information
Entity-predicative_information.description: Predicative information refers to the semantic characteristics and roles that nominals can assume in a sentence, particularly in the context of their interpretation within a model that distinguishes between generalizable and domain-specific semantic principles.

Entity-morpho-syntactic_and_semantic_cha.label: morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics
Entity-morpho-syntactic_and_semantic_cha.description: The term 'morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics' refers to the structural and meaning-related features of nominal constituents that are utilized to derive rules for the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English.

Entity-generalizable_semantic_principle.label: generalizable semantic principles
Entity-generalizable_semantic_principle.description: Generalizable semantic principles refer to overarching rules or frameworks that apply to the interpretation of meanings across various contexts, distinguishing them from specific semantic information tied to particular domains.

Entity-predicative_information_associate.label: predicative information associated with nominals
aliases: the predicative information associated with nominals
Entity-predicative_information_associate.description: Predicative information associated with nominals refers to the semantic and syntactic characteristics that define how nominal constituents can convey meaning and function within a sentence, particularly in the context of interpreting nominal compounds.

mentions.local_name: the predicative information associated with nominals

Entity-semantic_characteristic.label: semantic characteristics
Entity-semantic_characteristic.description: The term 'semantic characteristics' refers to the meaning-related features and properties of nominal constituents that are utilized in a model for interpreting nominal compounds in English.

Entity-compound.label: compounds
Entity-compound.description: In this context, 'compounds' refers to nominal compounds in English, which are linguistic units formed by combining two or more words to create a new meaning, and the paper discusses a model for their automated interpretation based on their morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics.

Entity-nominal.label: nominals
Entity-nominal.description: In this context, 'nominals' refers to linguistic expressions that function as nouns or noun phrases, particularly in the study of their morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics within the framework of automated interpretation of nominal compounds.

Entity-domain_independent_model.label: domain independent model
Entity-domain_independent_model.description: A domain independent model is a theoretical framework designed to function across various domains without being tailored to any specific one, allowing for generalized applications and interpretations.

Entity-domain-specific_semantic_informat.label: domain-specific semantic information
Entity-domain-specific_semantic_informat.description: Domain-specific semantic information refers to the specialized knowledge and contextual meanings that are unique to a particular domain or field, distinguishing it from generalizable semantic principles.

Entity-real_text.label: real texts
Entity-real_text.description: Real texts refer to actual written materials or documents in English that can be analyzed for the interpretation of nominal compounds using the proposed automated model.

Entity-nominal_compound.label: nominal compounds
Entity-nominal_compound.description: Nominal compounds are linguistic constructs formed by combining two or more nouns to create a single noun that conveys a specific meaning.

Entity-nominal_constituent.label: nominal constituents
Entity-nominal_constituent.description: Nominal constituents are linguistic elements that function as phrases or components within a sentence, typically representing entities, objects, or concepts.

Entity-pustejovsky.label: Pustejovsky
Entity-pustejovsky.description: Pustejovsky refers to a researcher and theorist known for contributions in the field of linguistics, particularly in relation to the semantics of language.

Entity-english.label: English
Entity-english.description: English is a West Germanic language that is the primary language spoken in England and widely used as a global lingua franca.

summary: A domain independent model is proposed for the automated interpretation of nominal compounds in English . This model is meant to account for productive rules of interpretation which are inferred from the morpho-syntactic and semantic characteristics of the nominal constituents . In particular , we make extensive use of Pustejovsky 's principles concerning the predicative information associated with nominals . We argue that it is necessary to draw a line between generalizable semantic principles and domain-specific semantic information . We explain this distinction and we show how this model may be applied to the interpretation of compounds in real texts , provided that complementary semantic information are retrieved .

Predicate-is_proposed_for.label: is proposed for
Predicate-is_proposed_for.description: The predicate 'is proposed for' indicates a suggestion or recommendation regarding the application or purpose of the subject. It connects the subject, which represents a concept, model, or solution, to the object, which specifies the intended use, goal, or area of focus for that subject. This relationship implies that the subject is being put forward as a viable option or strategy to address the needs or challenges outlined in the object.

Predicate-is_meant_to_account_for.label: is meant to account for
Predicate-is_meant_to_account_for.description: The predicate 'is meant to account for' indicates that the subject is intended to provide an explanation, justification, or framework for understanding the object. It suggests a purpose or function of the subject in relation to the object, implying that the subject serves to clarify, elucidate, or represent the object in a meaningful way.

Predicate-are_inferred_from.label: are inferred from
Predicate-are_inferred_from.description: The predicate 'are inferred from' establishes a relationship where the subject is derived or deduced based on the information or evidence provided by the object. It indicates that the characteristics or properties of the subject can be understood or concluded through the analysis of the object, suggesting a logical or analytical connection between the two.

Predicate-of.label: of
Predicate-of.description: The predicate 'of' serves to establish a relationship of belonging, association, or specification between the subject and the object in a triple. It indicates that the subject possesses certain qualities, attributes, or characteristics that are relevant to the object, thereby linking the two in a way that clarifies the nature of their connection. This relationship often implies that the object is a subset, a component, or a specific instance related to the broader context provided by the subject.

Predicate-concerning.label: concerning
Predicate-concerning.description: The predicate 'concerning' establishes a relationship of relevance or subject matter between the subject and the object, indicating that the object provides information, context, or details that are directly related to or pertain to the subject.

Predicate-draw_a_line_between.label: draw a line between
Predicate-draw_a_line_between.description: The predicate 'draw a line between' signifies the act of establishing a distinction or differentiation between two concepts, entities, or categories. It implies a comparative analysis that highlights the boundaries or contrasts that separate the subject from the object, thereby clarifying their respective roles, characteristics, or functions within a given context.

Predicate-applied_to.label: applied to
Predicate-applied_to.description: The predicate 'applied to' indicates a relationship where the subject is utilized or implemented in relation to the object, suggesting that the subject serves a functional role or purpose in the context of the object. This connection implies that the subject is relevant or beneficial for understanding, analyzing, or addressing the object.

Predicate-retrieved.label: retrieved
Predicate-retrieved.description: The predicate 'retrieved' indicates an action or process in which the subject is involved in obtaining or extracting information, data, or knowledge that is relevant to the object. It signifies a relationship where the subject serves as a source or repository of information, and the object represents the specific content or understanding that is acquired through this action.

Predicate-may_be_applied_to.label: may be applied to
Predicate-may_be_applied_to.description: The predicate 'may be applied to' indicates a potential or possible relationship where the subject can be utilized or implemented in relation to the object. It suggests that the subject has relevance or utility in the context of the object, allowing for the application of the subject's principles, methods, or findings to the object in question.

Predicate-are_retrieved_for.label: are retrieved for
Predicate-are_retrieved_for.description: The predicate 'are retrieved for' indicates a relationship where the subject is the source or entity that provides certain information, data, or resources, which are specifically sought after or utilized for the purpose stated in the object. This connection implies that the subject serves a functional role in supplying necessary elements that aid in achieving or understanding the objective outlined in the object.

Predicate-applies_to.label: applies to
Predicate-applies_to.description: The predicate 'applies to' establishes a relationship where the subject is relevant or suitable for the context or scenario described by the object. It indicates that the subject can be utilized, implemented, or is pertinent in relation to the object, suggesting a functional or contextual connection between the two.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the object represents a more general or inclusive category that encompasses the subject. This relationship suggests that the subject is a specific instance or subset within the broader category defined by the object.
